name: The Dubliner
address: 435 Plaza Real, Boca Raton, FL 33432
description: A proper Irish pub in the heart of Mizner Park with live music, cold Guinness, and a massive outdoor patio. Trivia nights pack the place, and the craic is always good.

name: Blue Martini
address: 6000 Glades Rd, Boca Raton, FL 33431
description: Upscale lounge at Town Center with live music, DJs, and a killer happy hour. Blue Martini is where Boca goes to dress up and dance. Over 40 signature martinis on the menu.

name: Mizner Park Grille
address: 327 Plaza Real, Boca Raton, FL 33432
description: Right on the Mizner Park promenade with excellent outdoor dining. Great spot for a date or a long happy hour people-watching on the boulevard.

name: Funky Buddha Brewery
address: 1201 NE 38th St, Oakland Park, FL 33334
description: South Florida's most beloved craft brewery with an enormous outdoor taproom. Floridian Hefeweizen and Maple Bacon Coffee Porter are legendary. Live music and food trucks on weekends.

name: Barrel of Monks Brewing
address: 1141 S Rogers Circle #5, Boca Raton, FL 33487
description: Belgian-inspired craft brewery tucked in an industrial park. Don't let the location fool you - the beer is world-class. Cozy taproom, friendly regulars, and some of the best Belgian-style ales in South Florida.

name: Rocco's Tacos & Tequila Bar
address: 5250 Town Center Circle, Boca Raton, FL 33486
description: Tableside guac, 400+ tequilas, and a vibe that gets rowdier as the margaritas flow. Rocco's is a Boca staple for group dinners that turn into late nights. Live music on weekends.

name: The Locale
address: 499 S Federal Hwy, Boca Raton, FL 33432
description: Neighborhood gastropub with pool tables, craft cocktails, and a laid-back atmosphere. Great trivia nights and the kind of place where you walk in a stranger and leave a regular.

name: The Biergarten
address: Royal Palm Place, 309 Via de Palmas, Boca Raton, FL 33432
description: German-inspired beer garden in Royal Palm Place with a huge outdoor space, rotating craft taps, and live music. Think communal tables, soft pretzels, and good times. Trivia on Wednesdays.

name: Dead Owl Brewing
address: 840 N Dixie Hwy, Boca Raton, FL 33432
description: Small-batch craft brewery on Dixie Hwy with rotating taps and a chill taproom. Dog-friendly, unpretentious, and the kind of hidden gem locals don't want you to know about.

name: Boca Beer House
address: 15 SE 1st Ave, Boca Raton, FL 33432
description: Craft beer bar in downtown Boca with a rotating selection of 30+ taps, great bar snacks, and a mellow atmosphere. Beer nerds feel at home here.

name: Bogart Bar at the Boca Raton Resort
address: 501 E Camino Real, Boca Raton, FL 33432
description: Speakeasy-inspired cocktail bar inside the iconic Boca Raton resort. Craft cocktails, moody lighting, and an old-Hollywood vibe. Named after Humphrey Bogart, who was a regular at the original resort.

name: The Field Irish Pub
address: 5240 Town Center Circle, Boca Raton, FL 33486
description: Authentic Irish pub at Town Center with live music, sports on every screen, and proper pub grub. Trivia on Tuesdays, live bands on weekends, and enough TVs for every game.

name: Red Reef Park
address: 1400 N Ocean Blvd, Boca Raton, FL 33432
description: The snorkeling here is the best in the area, hands down. The artificial reef is right off the beach and you'll see tropical fish, sea turtles, and the occasional nurse shark. Get there early for parking.

name: Gumbo Limbo Nature Center
address: 1801 N Ocean Blvd, Boca Raton, FL 33432
description: Sea turtle rehab, a boardwalk through a tropical hammock, and aquarium tanks full of local marine life. It's free (donations appreciated) and genuinely one of the best nature centers in the state.

name: Boca Raton GreenMarket
address: Royal Palm Place, 399 SE Mizner Blvd, Boca Raton, FL 33432
description: Saturday mornings at Royal Palm Place. Not as big as Delray's market but the produce is just as good and the parking situation is way easier. Great smoothie vendors.

name: Sugar Sand Park
address: 300 S Military Trail, Boca Raton, FL 33486
description: The best park for families in Boca, no question. Massive playground, the Children's Science Explorium, a carousel, and plenty of open space. The splash pad in summer is clutch.

name: Deerfield Beach International Fishing Pier
address: 200 NE 21st Ave, Deerfield Beach, FL 33441
description: Technically Deerfield but everyone in Boca fishes here. 976 feet out into the ocean, rod rentals available, and the bait shop has everything you need. Show up early for the best spots.

name: Mizner Park
address: 327 Plaza Real, Boca Raton, FL 33432
description: The cultural center of Boca. Great restaurants, the Boca Museum of Art, an amphitheater for outdoor concerts, and a big green space where they host festivals and movie nights.

name: Patch Reef Park
address: 2000 NW 51st St, Boca Raton, FL 33431
description: If you want to play tennis, pickleball, or basketball in Boca, this is the spot. Well-maintained courts, a nice playground area, and enough space that it never feels crowded.

name: Spanish River Park
address: 3001 N Ocean Blvd, Boca Raton, FL 33431
description: One of the nicest beach parks in all of South Florida. Nature trails, picnic pavilions, and a gorgeous stretch of beach. The tunnel under A1A to get to the beach is kind of fun too.

name: Boca Raton Paddleboard & Kayak
address: 1798 NE 5th Ave, Boca Raton, FL 33432
description: Paddleboard and kayak rentals right on the Intracoastal. They do guided tours where you'll see manatees and maybe dolphins. Sunset tour is the move if you can only do one.

name: Yoga Journey
address: 398 NE Spanish River Blvd, Boca Raton, FL 33431
description: One of the best yoga studios in Boca with a huge variety of classes. Hot yoga, restorative, power flow, you name it. The teachers are legit and the space is clean and calming.

name: Bluegrass
address: Royal Palm Place, 101 Plaza Real S, Boca Raton, FL 33432
description: Solid brunch spot in Royal Palm Place with a great outdoor patio. The chicken and waffles are famous for a reason. Weekend brunch gets busy so plan accordingly.

name: Boca Raton Museum of Art
address: 501 Plaza Real, Boca Raton, FL 33432
description: Right in Mizner Park with rotating exhibitions that are always better than you'd expect. Thursday evenings are extended hours and usually have a cool event or talk. Great date spot.
